summary: The Hijri calendar, also known as the Islamic or Muslim calendar, is a lunar calendar used to determine Islamic holidays and rituals. It has 12 months and 354 or 355 days in a year. The calendar starts from the year 622 CE, when Muhammad moved from Mecca to Medina, an event called the Hijrah. Islamic years are denoted as AH (After Hijrah) and non-Islamic years before this event as BH (Before Hijrah). Currently, we are in the year 1446 AH, which started on July 7, 2024, in the Gregorian calendar.
title: Islamic calendar
